people_also_ask.heading: Posture correctors are often recommended for patients with mild cases of misalignment, says Dr. Okubadejo; in other words, if you're having general neck pain, back pain, or headaches, or your posture is noticeably slouched, a posture corrector can help you retrain your muscles into a healthier alignment.

people_also_ask.heading: Even if your posture has been a problem for years, it's possible to make improvements.
